metadata.title: CVE-2014-8127 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
LibTIFF 4.0.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds read and crash) via a crafted TIFF image to the (1)checkInkNamesString function in tif_dir.c in the thumbnail tool, (2)compresscontig function in tiff2bw.c in the tiff2bw tool, (3)putcontig8bitCIELab function in tif_getimage.c in the tiff2rgba tool,LZWPreDecode function in tif_lzw.c in the (4) tiff2ps or (5) tiffdithertool, (6) NeXTDecode function in tif_next.c in the tiffmedian tool, or (7)TIFFWriteDirectoryTagLongLong8Array function in tif_dirwrite.c in thetiffset tool.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8127` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2').
